member.name: T:SpreadsheetGUI.Startup

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.Startup.#ctor
member.summary:
This is the constructor for the startup method.
It will create a new socket to connect to the provided IP address on the specified port #. It will then pass along the socket to the OPEN prompt, where the user will specify the file name and whether they will create a new file, or join an existing file.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.Startup.ConnectButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method will connect the client to the server. The user will then be directed to the next prompt, the open prompt.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.Startup.GoToOpenPrompt(SpreadsheetGUI.SSModel)
member.summary: This method is the callback for connecting to the server. It will then direct the user to the next prompt to open/create a file.

member.summary: This property will keep track of the Port number that was entered by the user.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGUI.StartupModel
member.summary:
This is the main model of the Spreadsheet connection.
It will keep track of all of the SSModels that are open, where each SSModel represents a new spreadsheet that's open. This will help to keep track of different spreadsheets open by one user.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.StartupModel.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructor for creating a new StartupModel.
It will intialize the neccessary member variables.

member.summary: Used to connect the client to the server

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.StartupModel.newSSModel
member.summary: This method will be called to get a new SSModel to follow a spreadsheet.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGUI.StartupModel.socket
member.summary: This property keeps track of the underlying socket that connects the client to the server.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.Form1.CellContentBox_KeyUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Allows the user to use the keyboard to control data entry from the keyboard. While the CellContentBox is selected, the user must use the enter key to input the data into the spreadsheet, and may use the arrows to navigate the spreadsheet cells. Also, when control + w is pressed, the option to close the Window will be presented to the user.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.Form1.SetCellContents(SS.SpreadsheetPanel)
member.summary: A helper method to set the contents of the cell in the spreadsheetPanel. This will actually display on the panel the inputed information.

member.summary: When the clear button is clicked on the Window, the spreadsheetPanel, spreadsheet, CellContentBox and CellValueBox will be cleared.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt
member.summary: Partial class for dealing with an open prompt window.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt.#ctor(SpreadsheetGUI.SSModel)
member.summary: This method will open a new prompt window, which a user will be able to enter in a file to either create a new spreadsheet of or join an existing file.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt.NewButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
This method is for when the "New" button is clicked in the GUI.
It will send the appropiate message to the client, and begin receiving with the correct callback method.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt.JoinButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
This method is for when the "Join" button is clicked in the GUI.
It will send the appropiate message to the server and begin receiving with the correct callback.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt.createReceived(System.String,System.Exception,System.Object)
member.summary:
This is the callback method for the "Create" message.
This will report to the user whether they will be able to create a new spreadsheet, or if there's an error that occurred.
If there was an error it reports the error to the user, if the connection was successful it will report to the user the name and spreadsheet.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGUI.OpenPrompt.joinReceived(System.String,System.Exception,System.Object)
member.summary:
This method is the callback for the "Join" message.
This will report to the user whether they will be able to join a spreadsheet, or if there's an error that occurred.
If there was an error it reports the error to the user, if the connection was successful it will report to the user the name and spreadsheet.

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.
